title: Necromancer
data:
- - *For the Wizard rank of the same name in vanilla NetHack, see [Wizard#Rank\_titles](/wiki/Wizard#Rank_titles "Wizard").*
  - *For the Elvish Quest Nemesis, see [Necromancer (Quest Nemesis)](/wiki/Necromancer_\(Quest_Nemesis\) "Necromancer (Quest Nemesis)").*

The **Necromancer** is a [role](/wiki/Role "Role") specific to *[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM")*. Necromancers specialize in the command of [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") pets. All necromancers follow the [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") god, [Gothuulbe](/wiki/Gothuulbe "Gothuulbe").

The necromancer role is quite similar to the wizard role. Like the wizards, the necromancers are relatively poor fighters with low [HP](/wiki/HP "HP") and [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"), but good [spellcasters](/wiki/Spell "Spell"). The necromancers remain restricted in all categories except attack spells and matter spells. They can be a [human](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)"), [orc](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)"), [doppelganger](/wiki/Doppelganger_\(starting_race\) "Doppelganger (starting race)"), [drow](/wiki/Drow "Drow") or [vampire](/wiki/Vampire_\(starting_race\) "Vampire (starting race)"). A necromancer will start with a [pet](/wiki/Pet_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Pet (SLASH'EM)"), which is always a tame [ghoul](/wiki/Ghoul "Ghoul"). A ghoul is very slow (at speed 6, moving half as fast as you) and eats only old corpses. according to the guide book:

Necromancers have delved into the darkest of the magical lore, and mastered some of the most forbidden of the magical lore. Many have fallen to the armies of the undead that they are capable of bringing forth and controlling.

[ ]

## Starting equipment

- blessed +1 [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff") (weapon in hand)
- 2 random rings
- 3 random potions
- 3 random scrolls
- [spellbook of summon undead](/wiki/Spellbook_of_summon_undead "Spellbook of summon undead")
- [spellbook of command undead](/wiki/Spellbook_of_command_undead "Spellbook of command undead")
- [spellbook of drain life](/wiki/Spellbook_of_drain_life "Spellbook of drain life")
- one of these five books: [spellbook of force bolt](/wiki/Spellbook_of_force_bolt "Spellbook of force bolt"), [spellbook of knock](/wiki/Spellbook_of_knock "Spellbook of knock"), [spellbook of magic missile](/wiki/Spellbook_of_magic_missile "Spellbook of magic missile"), [spellbook of create monster](/wiki/Spellbook_of_create_monster "Spellbook of create monster") or [spellbook of wizard lock](/wiki/Spellbook_of_wizard_lock "Spellbook of wizard lock")
- [wand of draining](/wiki/Wand_of_draining "Wand of draining")
- +0 [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe") (alternate weapon)
- 20% chance of [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker")
- 20% chance of [blindfold](/wiki/Blindfold "Blindfold")

The starting inventory lacks both [food](/wiki/Food "Food") and [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor"). You may need use [prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer") to delay [starvation](/wiki/Starvation "Starvation").

## Abilities

Like the [Priest](/wiki/Priest "Priest"), the necromancers can naturally recognize the [blessed or cursed status](/wiki/BUC "BUC") of each object. (This ability is especially important to a necromancer because undead pets will not avoid cursed objects; they avoid blessed objects instead.) Use this ability to salvage [weapons](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") and [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor") from the dungeon, avoiding cursed armor.

Each necromancer begins with two intrinsics, [level-drain resistance](/wiki/Level-drain_resistance "Level-drain resistance") and [immunity to sickness](/wiki/Immunity_to_sickness "Immunity to sickness"). At experience level 3, the necromancer gains intrinsic [warning against undead](/wiki/Warning_against_undead "Warning against undead"), which provides detection of all undead monsters on the level (and allows you to know the location of your undead army).

## Skills

The necromancer begins with Basic skill in [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff"), [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe") and attack spells. Those that enter the dungeon with a spellbook from the matter category, also begin with Basic skill in matter spells.

| Necromancer skills |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max                | Skills                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| Basic              | - *Weapons:* [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace"), [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear"), [trident](/wiki/Trident "Trident"), [javelin](/wiki/Javelin "Javelin"), [shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken")
- *Combat:* [bare hands](/wiki/Bare_hands "Bare hands")                                                       |
| Skilled            | * *Weapons:* [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe"), [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe"), [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [polearms](/wiki/Polearms "Polearms"), [sling](/wiki/Sling "Sling")                                                                                          |
| Expert             | - *Weapons:* [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [quarterstaff](/wiki/Staff "Staff"), [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart")
- *Spells:* [matter](/wiki/Spellcasting_\(SLASH%27EM\)#Matter_spells "Spellcasting (SLASH'EM)"), [attack](/wiki/Spellcasting_\(SLASH%27EM\)#Attack_spells "Spellcasting (SLASH'EM)") |

| 10                           | [power surge](/wiki/Power_surge "Power surge")                |
| 15                           | [sigil of tempest](/wiki/Sigil_of_tempest "Sigil of tempest") |

## Rank titles

|                              |               |
| ---------------------------- | ------------- |
| [Level](/wiki/Level "Level") | Title         |
| 1-2                          | Gravedigger   |
| 3-5                          | Embalmer      |
| 6-9                          | Mortician     |
| 10-13                        | Zombie Lord   |
| 14-17                        | Ghoul Master  |
| 18-25                        | Necromancer   |
| 26-29                        | Undead Master |
| 30                           | Lich Lord     |

## Strategy

Necromancers are one of the more difficult roles to play. Most of the role's skills and techniques that matter don't make a big difference until late in the game; until then, you are playing a weak fighter or subpar wizard who can eat old corpses and make weak zombie pets in the mines.

Your starting spells of [summon undead](/wiki/Spellbook_of_summon_undead "Spellbook of summon undead") and [command undead](/wiki/Spellbook_of_command_undead "Spellbook of command undead") are unhelpful in the beginning as you will likely a 100% failure rate for all of the early game and most of the midgame. Play the early game like a tank, putting on all armor that isn't cursed and training [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") skill to get the bonus to-hit and [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot") benefit. A [Drow](/wiki/Drow "Drow"), by contrast, should train daggers by throwing them, but fight bare-handed in melee to take advantage of the sleep attack. You will frequently need to run away from fights and use Elbereth to survive at the beginning. Use your [wand of draining](/wiki/Wand_of_draining "Wand of draining") in emergencies, but be judicious; once it's used up, you're on your own. Also, save fortune cookies and the like to tame dogs and cats, and keep a [lichen](/wiki/Lichen "Lichen") corpse around to pacify them in an emergency.

Head first for the mall and buy or steal any decent weapons, armor, rings (200/300 cost), and wands you find. If you find any potions of gain level, dip your [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe") to get a [dwarvish mattock](/wiki/Dwarvish_mattock "Dwarvish mattock"). Go ahead and train skill in this until you find an altar to get your first sacrifice gift, the inimitable [Serpent's Tongue](/wiki/Serpent%27s_Tongue "Serpent's Tongue"). Once you have cleared out the mall of goodies, head for the mines.

The [raise zombies](/wiki/Raise_zombies "Raise zombies") technique can help marginally in the mines, mostly by distracting foes and providing something to dodge behind when tough enemies come your way. If you find yourself surrounded by dead humanoids and satiated, place one in each square around you and activate the technique. Zombies can be created from kobolds, gnomes, dwarves, elves, orcs (including goblins), humans, ettins, and giants, although by the time you see the latter two they are probably not going to be much help to you. In general, all other humanoids will become ghouls or ghasts. Ghouls and ghasts are stronger than most early zombies, which means hobbit corpses are particularly good for raising. [Vampire](/wiki/Vampire_\(starting_race\) "Vampire (starting race)") necromancers can raise drained corpses, but will likely find them too slow to keep up with the frenetic pace of the vampire's early game without a [magic whistle](/wiki/Magic_whistle "Magic whistle").

If you're lucky enough to find an altar to Gothuulbe in the mines, camp out and sacrifice for [Serpent's Tongue](/wiki/Serpent%27s_Tongue "Serpent's Tongue"). Look for [scrolls of enchant weapon](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_weapon "Scroll of enchant weapon") and get this up to +6/+7 as soon as possible, as it will do double damage on the enchantment bonus. If not, head back up to the main dungeon and make your way to [sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban"). Be sure to fully explore every level until you find an altar. If you haven't found one by level 19, you can always use the guaranteed co-aligned altar in the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest"), but it may be difficult to survive against the killer rations, piles of killer coins, and werecreatures you'll meet there if the altar ends up far from the entry portal. Don't attempt your role quest yet; [Maugneshaagar](/wiki/Maugneshaagar "Maugneshaagar") is a powerful foe, and the [Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa](/wiki/Great_Dagger_of_Glaurgnaa "Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa") is not as good a weapon as a well-enchanted [Serpent's Tongue](/wiki/Serpent%27s_Tongue "Serpent's Tongue"). After you get your artifact weapon, head to [One-Eyed Sam](/wiki/One-Eyed_Sam "One-Eyed Sam")'s black market and clear it out. By the time you have done that, and used all the [scrolls of enchant weapon](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_weapon "Scroll of enchant weapon") and [enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor"), you should be strong enough to try some of the other branches, including [Grund's Stronghold](/wiki/Grund%27s_Stronghold "Grund's Stronghold") (don't attempt without [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance")), the [Chaotic Quest](/wiki/Chaotic_Quest "Chaotic Quest") (don't go without a [wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire") or [lightning](/wiki/Wand_of_lightning "Wand of lightning")), the [Wyrm Caves](/wiki/Wyrm_Caves "Wyrm Caves"), and the [Necromancer quest](/wiki/Necromancer_quest "Necromancer quest").

The [Necromancer quest](/wiki/Necromancer_quest "Necromancer quest") will yield the [Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa](/wiki/Great_Dagger_of_Glaurgnaa "Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa"), which drains enemies just as [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer") does, grants magic resistance when carried, and most importantly provides a magic power boost when #invoked, much like [The Mitre of Holiness](/wiki/The_Mitre_of_Holiness "The Mitre of Holiness"). If you have managed to get DSM by this time, you may switch to spellcasting mode, and the Great Dagger will be a huge boon as you will find yourself running out of magic power frequently due to the Necromancer's low power growth. The Great Dagger will also make a good weapon against poison-resistant foes, however, you should try to sacrifice for a better weapon such as [Doomblade](/wiki/Doomblade "Doomblade"), [Bat from Hell](/wiki/Bat_from_Hell "Bat from Hell"), [Frost Brand](/wiki/Frost_Brand "Frost Brand"), or [Fire Brand](/wiki/Fire_Brand "Fire Brand"). Whichever you make your primary weapon, do advance the relevant skill to max.

By the endgame, the Necromancer will have become quite formidable. The class's natural immunity to [sickness](/wiki/Sickness "Sickness") takes the sting away from usually fearsome opponents such as [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon") and [Pestilence](/wiki/Pestilence "Pestilence"). Innate [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") means you don't have to waste a valuable armor, amulet, or weapon slot on it, not to mention making the [Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers](/wiki/Guild_of_Disgruntled_Adventurers "Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers"), the [Wyrm Caves](/wiki/Wyrm_Caves "Wyrm Caves"), and [The Lost Tomb](/wiki/The_Lost_Tomb "The Lost Tomb") significantly easier. By the time you have gotten your spellcasting mojo on, your starting spells of command undead and summon undead become extremely useful, and can net you an army of powerful pets. Your [sigil of tempest](/wiki/Sigil_of_tempest "Sigil of tempest") technique will make ordinary ray attacks such as [magic missile](/wiki/Magic_missile "Magic missile") and [cone of cold](/wiki/Cone_of_cold "Cone of cold") into powerful area attacks. Necromancers can eventually become extremely powerful offensive magicians, attaining expert in both [attack](/wiki/Attack_spells "Attack spells") and [matter spells](/wiki/Matter_spells "Matter spells").

A good [ascension kit](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit") for a Necromancer is:

- +7 [Bat from Hell](/wiki/Bat_from_Hell "Bat from Hell"), [Doomblade](/wiki/Doomblade "Doomblade"), [Frost Brand](/wiki/Frost_Brand "Frost Brand"), [Fire Brand](/wiki/Fire_Brand "Fire Brand"), or [Serpent's Tongue](/wiki/Serpent%27s_Tongue "Serpent's Tongue"), with the [Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa](/wiki/Great_Dagger_of_Glaurgnaa "Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa") as a backup weapon
- One of the following: +5 [speed boots](/wiki/Speed_boots "Speed boots") for the extra attacks, +7 [elven boots](/wiki/Elven_boots "Elven boots") for the AC, +5 [jumping boots](/wiki/Jumping_boots "Jumping boots") for the extra movement, or +5 fireproof [water walking boots](/wiki/Water_walking_boots "Water walking boots") to survive [create pool](/wiki/Create_pool "Create pool") spells
- +7 [cloak of magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance") (enchant an [elven cloak](/wiki/Elven_cloak "Elven cloak") to +7 and then [upgrade](/wiki/Upgrading_objects "Upgrading objects") it)
- +5 [gauntlets of dexterity](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_dexterity "Gauntlets of dexterity")
- +5 [silver dragon scale mail](/wiki/Silver_dragon_scale_mail "Silver dragon scale mail") for the reflection
- +5 [helm of brilliance](/wiki/Helm_of_brilliance "Helm of brilliance")
- an [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving") or [flying](/wiki/Amulet_of_flying "Amulet of flying"), or an [amulet of reflection](/wiki/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection") if opting for body armor other than SDSM
- All the other items (rings, wands, tools, etc.) in a standard ascension kit

## NetHack

In NetHack, "Necromancer" is the [rank title](/wiki/Rank "Rank") given to a [wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") between level 22 and level 25.

## See also

- [Necromancer quest](/wiki/Necromancer_quest "Necromancer quest")
- [Raise zombies](/wiki/Raise_zombies "Raise zombies")

Necromancer

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For the Wizard rank of the same name in vanilla NetHack, see Wizard#Rank_titles.
For the Elvish Quest Nemesis, see Necromancer (Quest Nemesis).

A necromancer will start with a pet, which is always a tame ghoul. A ghoul is very slow (at speed 6, moving half as fast as you) and eats only old corpses. according to the guide book:

If not, head back up to the main dungeon and make your way to sokoban. Be sure to fully explore every level until you find an altar. By the endgame, the Necromancer will have become quite formidable. The class's natural immunity to sickness takes the sting away from usually fearsome opponents such as Demogorgon and Pestilence. Innate drain resistance means you don't have to waste a valuable armor, amulet, or weapon slot on it, not to mention making the Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers, the Wyrm Caves, and The Lost Tomb significantly easier. Your sigil of tempest technique will make ordinary ray attacks such as magic missile and cone of cold into powerful area attacks. Necromancers can eventually become extremely powerful offensive magicians, attaining expert in both attack and matter spells.

A good ascension kit for a Necromancer is:

  • +7 Bat from Hell, Doomblade, Frost Brand, Fire Brand, or Serpent's Tongue, with the Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa as a backup weapon

  • +5 gauntlets of dexterity
  • +5 silver dragon scale mail for the reflection
  • +5 helm of brilliance

* blessed +1 [[quarterstaff]] (weapon in hand)
* 2 random rings
* 3 random potions
* 3 random scrolls
* [[spellbook of summon undead]]
* [[spellbook of command undead]]
* [[spellbook of drain life]]
* one of these five books: [[spellbook of force bolt]], [[spellbook of knock]], [[spellbook of magic missile]], [[spellbook of create monster]] or [[spellbook of wizard lock]]
* [[wand of draining]]
* +0 [[pick-axe]] (alternate weapon)
* 20% chance of [[magic marker]]
* 20% chance of [[blindfold]]

The starting inventory lacks both [[food]] and [[armor]]. You may need use [[prayer]] to delay [[starvation]].

== Abilities ==
Like the [[Priest]], the necromancers can naturally recognize the [[BUC|blessed or cursed status]] of each object. (This ability is especially important to a necromancer because undead pets will not avoid cursed objects; they avoid blessed objects instead.) Use this ability to salvage [[weapon]]s and [[armor]] from the dungeon, avoiding cursed armor.

Each necromancer begins with two intrinsics, [[level-drain resistance]] and [[immunity to sickness]]. At experience level 3, the necromancer gains intrinsic [[warning against undead]], which provides detection of all undead monsters on the level (and allows you to know the location of your undead army).

==Strategy==
Necromancers are one of the more difficult roles to play. Most of the role's skills and techniques that matter don't make a big difference until late in the game; until then, you are playing a weak fighter or subpar wizard who can eat old corpses and make weak zombie pets in the mines.

Your starting spells of [[Spellbook of summon undead|summon undead]] and [[Spellbook of command undead|command undead]] are unhelpful in the beginning as you will likely a 100% failure rate for all of the early game and most of the midgame. Play the early game like a tank, putting on all armor that isn't cursed and training [[dagger]] skill to get the bonus to-hit and [[multishot]] benefit. A [[Drow]], by contrast, should train daggers by throwing them, but fight bare-handed in melee to take advantage of the sleep attack. You will frequently need to run away from fights and use Elbereth to survive at the beginning. Use your [[wand of draining]] in emergencies, but be judicious; once it's used up, you're on your own. Also, save fortune cookies and the like to tame dogs and cats, and keep a [[lichen]] corpse around to pacify them in an emergency.

Head first for the mall and buy or steal any decent weapons, armor, rings (200/300 cost), and wands you find. If you find any potions of gain level, dip your [[pick-axe]] to get a [[dwarvish mattock]]. Go ahead and train skill in this until you find an altar to get your first sacrifice gift, the inimitable [[Serpent's Tongue]]. Once you have cleared out the mall of goodies, head for the mines.

The [[raise zombies]] technique can help marginally in the mines, mostly by distracting foes and providing something to dodge behind when tough enemies come your way. If you find yourself surrounded by dead humanoids and satiated, place one in each square around you and activate the technique. Zombies can be created from kobolds, gnomes, dwarves, elves, orcs (including goblins), humans, ettins, and giants, although by the time you see the latter two they are probably not going to be much help to you. In general, all other humanoids will become ghouls or ghasts. Ghouls and ghasts are stronger than most early zombies, which means hobbit corpses are particularly good for raising. [[Vampire (starting race)|Vampire]] necromancers can raise drained corpses, but will likely find them too slow to keep up with the frenetic pace of the vampire's early game without a [[magic whistle]].

If you're lucky enough to find an altar to Gothuulbe in the mines, camp out and sacrifice for [[Serpent's Tongue]]. Look for [[scroll of enchant weapon|scrolls of enchant weapon]] and get this up to +6/+7 as soon as possible, as it will do double damage on the enchantment bonus. If not, head back up to the main dungeon and make your way to [[sokoban]]. Be sure to fully explore every level until you find an altar. If you haven't found one by level 19, you can always use the guaranteed co-aligned altar in the [[Lawful Quest]], but it may be difficult to survive against the killer rations, piles of killer coins, and werecreatures you'll meet there if the altar ends up far from the entry portal. Don't attempt your role quest yet; [[Maugneshaagar]] is a powerful foe, and the [[Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa]] is not as good a weapon as a well-enchanted [[Serpent's Tongue]]. After you get your artifact weapon, head to [[One-Eyed Sam]]'s black market and clear it out. By the time you have done that, and used all the [[scroll of enchant weapon|scrolls of enchant weapon]] and [[scroll of enchant armor|enchant armor]], you should be strong enough to try some of the other branches, including [[Grund's Stronghold]] (don't attempt without [[fire resistance]]), the [[Chaotic Quest]] (don't go without a [[wand of fire]] or [[wand of lightning|lightning]]), the [[Wyrm Caves]], and the [[Necromancer quest]].

The [[Necromancer quest]] will yield the [[Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa]], which drains enemies just as [[Stormbringer]] does, grants magic resistance when carried, and most importantly provides a magic power boost when #invoked, much like [[The Mitre of Holiness]]. If you have managed to get DSM by this time, you may switch to spellcasting mode, and the Great Dagger will be a huge boon as you will find yourself running out of magic power frequently due to the Necromancer's low power growth. The Great Dagger will also make a good weapon against poison-resistant foes, however, you should try to sacrifice for a better weapon such as [[Doomblade]], [[Bat from Hell]], [[Frost Brand]], or [[Fire Brand]]. Whichever you make your primary weapon, do advance the relevant skill to max.

By the endgame, the Necromancer will have become quite formidable. The class's natural immunity to [[sickness]] takes the sting away from usually fearsome opponents such as [[Demogorgon]] and [[Pestilence]]. Innate [[drain resistance]] means you don't have to waste a valuable armor, amulet, or weapon slot on it, not to mention making the [[Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers]], the [[Wyrm Caves]], and [[The Lost Tomb]] significantly easier. By the time you have gotten your spellcasting mojo on, your starting spells of command undead and summon undead become extremely useful, and can net you an army of powerful pets. Your [[sigil of tempest]] technique will make ordinary ray attacks such as [[magic missile]] and [[cone of cold]] into powerful area attacks. Necromancers can eventually become extremely powerful offensive magicians, attaining expert in both [[attack spells|attack]] and [[matter spells]].

A good [[ascension kit]] for a Necromancer is:
*+7 [[Bat from Hell]], [[Doomblade]], [[Frost Brand]], [[Fire Brand]], or [[Serpent's Tongue]], with the [[Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa]] as a backup weapon
*One of the following: +5 [[speed boots]] for the extra attacks, +7 [[elven boots]] for the AC, +5 [[jumping boots]] for the extra movement, or +5 fireproof [[water walking boots]] to survive [[create pool]] spells
*+7 [[cloak of magic resistance]] (enchant an [[elven cloak]] to +7 and then [[upgrading objects|upgrade]] it)
*+5 [[gauntlets of dexterity]]
*+5 [[silver dragon scale mail]] for the reflection
*+5 [[helm of brilliance]]
*an [[amulet of life saving]] or [[amulet of flying|flying]], or an [[amulet of reflection]] if opting for body armor other than SDSM
*All the other items (rings, wands, tools, etc.) in a standard ascension kit

==NetHack==
In NetHack, "Necromancer" is the [[Rank|rank title]] given to a [[wizard]] between level 22 and level 25.
